      • getLoggerForClass

      • setNewTraceFile

        public void setNewTraceFile(int level,
                   java.lang.String fileName)
        In case a tracing is on, it will close the existing the trace file and open a new trace file. Note that there are 2 try/catch blocks so that we know where exactly the exception occurred.

      • writeTrace

        public void writeTrace(java.lang.Object logger,
              int levelNum,
              byte[] byteData,
              int offset,
              char format,
              int size)
        With Logger Write byte data to the trace file. Note that we dump byte data to the trace file either just hex or hex and ascii. If the format is 'h' or 'H' then it's just hex. If the format is 'B' or 'b' then we do both hex and ascii.
